author: Terrynce D. Adams

review: I have used a plethora of devices for years for streaming. My main sources for streaming are (in order of use): Vudu, Plex, Amazon Instant, XBMC, PlayOn and Netflix. Roku 3 is my primary go-to and I have no problems with it whatsoever. I decided to buy this when it went on special to tinker with it and and see what it could do.Pros:- Comes pre-installed with your Amazon account info. Amazon services just work out of the box.- Has a decent menu system.- Voice search is robust.- Support for Plex, Amazon Instant, and NetflixCons:- Woeful lack of premier streaming apps, most notably (for me):  -- No VUDU app.  -- No PlayOn app.  -- No XBMC app.- All of my apps in Amazon are not accessible in the apps gallery on the FireTV.- No way to prioritize/organize my apps. They just appear how they want to, I think based on usage.- While the voice search is cool, it just feels trendy. I prefer to scroll through my media.The thing I really didn't expect was a lack of PlayOn support, because Amazon has PlayOn in their app store.This doesn't make the device unusable, but it does keep it from replacing my Roku and will also make me not use it for now until it gets some further updates and support. It just can't do what I want it to do, even if I side load the apps.

review: I spent about an hour yesterday on the phone with Amazon help desk trying to get this to work on my Samsung Smart TV and my Bose surround sound system. Still no resolution and the issue has been elevated. I have another TV with a sound bar and have no issues, but I don't want the box on that TV. I gave it 3 stars for this reason. Now that I've had a chance to actually use it with my other TV I can say that the content is pretty decent. I'm a Prime member and all the usual programming is decent. I'm ready to cut the Direct TV and wanted to use this as well as an HD antenna to pick up local channels. It's a much cheaper option for the limited TV I watch. The only drawback is the limited access to sports like NFL and college football games and tennis. I've figured out a workaround for that though. Once Amazon figures out how to get this working with my other TV then I'll be ditching satellite and sticking with this option. It's really a simple device to use. That's why I'm surprised that Amazon can't figure out how to get this to work with my other TV. I also found the help manuals and videos to be less than helpful. They cover very basic issues and the troubleshooting section is really weak.

review: The Good: Very quick, very easy to set up and use, and very inconspicuous sitting next to the TV.The Bad: My only issue with Fire TV so far is using PLEX to stream photos, music and video to the TV from a computer.It works, but the PLEX program seems overly complicated to use. And there seems to be basic functions missing in PLEX such as shuffle all music, not just one artist or album.It could be me - though I feel I'm better than average with using media software - Amazon needs to step up and build in something more familiar to us Amazonians (is that a term?!) for the streaming from PC functions than PLEX.Otherwise - at $99 this is a heck of a unit. And with Prime included a sweet deal. Fix the PLEX thing and I'll resubmit a 5th star
